result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Richard Scholz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Per Judge Eric J. Lundell May 26, 2017 - add condition time.

Concurrent with any existing Probation.
Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6 for purposes of restitution.
Defendant to report to Probation today September 15, 2016.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Benoy  2:01   Probation Agent: Kasondra Moll in court.  DF:  Nathan Richard Scholz appeared from jail, pro se.  Probation agent is requesting addtional time due to an incident that occured on 5/18/17.  Court orders an additional 180 days conditional time with 8 days credit.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Sharesa Desotelle, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Erica Ellenwood, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Nathan Richard Scholz appeared.  Court called.  Set for PTC.  There is an agreement.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1.   Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds the DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt reads for purposes of restitution in and dismisses Ct 2, Ct 3, Ct 4, Ct 5 & Ct 6. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

Ct. 1 16CF30
- W/S 2 years probation with conditions to run concurrent with any existing probation
- AODA and follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- MRT program
- Restitution in the amount of $681.30 to be paid through the DOC
- Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 for the DNA surcharge to be paid through the DOC
- DE to report to the probation office today 09/15/16
- DE's bond to remain in effect until DE has signed up for probation and then it is vacated
- 20 days to appeal
Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Verified the DE's address.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned.  lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Nathan Richard Scholz appeared.  Court called.  Set for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing on April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Robert W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Nathan Richard Scholz appeared. Court confirms address.
